titlestmt.titleproper: RG 074:055, Edmund Janes Cleveland Genealogical Papers

did.head: Overview of the Collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The genealogy of the Cleveland and Cleaveland families : an attempt to trace, in both the male and female lines, the posterity of Moses Cleveland ... of Alexander Cleveland ... : also a bibliography of the Cleveland family and a genealogical account of Edward Winn of Woburn, and of other Winn families / compiled by Edmund Janes Cleveland and Horace Gillette Cleveland
Cleveland, Cleaveland family : History and Genealogy Unit Special Genealogical File, 1815-1938

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Purchased by the Connecticut State Library on January 4, 1945 from Cedric W. Case, Mulberry Street, Hartford, Connecticut.

Transfered to the State Archives from the general collection during the Retrospective Conversion project in August 1995. Formerly catalogued as 929.2 C595c SuppL. 1-5. The three published volumes remain in the general collection.

did.unittitle: Supplement to the genealogy of the Cleveland and Cleaveland families, Vol. IV / compiled by Edmund Janes Cleveland

scopecontent.p: Records, biographical sketches, ancestries, additions and corrections.

did.unittitle: List of individuals and libraries to whom circulars for the Cleveland genealogy were sent, about 1894-1902

scopecontent.p: Correspondence is bound together with ledger.

did.unittitle: Manuscript copy of a genealogy of Moses Cleveland of Woburn, Mass. 1879; Index of ancestors and arms in Cleveland genealogy; Miscellaneous notes and lists

scopecontent.p: Circulars describing Cleveland genealogy; reviews, newspaper clippings; catalogue of book dealers.

did.unittitle: Record of 600 numbered copied of Cleveland Genealogy; Index of purchasers

note.p: Volume spine states Moses Gleveland, of Woburn 1635, Isaac2, 1., E.J.C.
